sen.j: 三大事件建白運動（さんだいじけんけんぱくうんどう）とは、1887年（明治20年）10月に片岡健吉が元老院_(日本)に提出した建白書（「三大事件建白」）をきっかけに起きた政治運動。
sen.e: The campaign of the three biggest petitions is a political movement caused by petitions ("The three biggest petitions") submitted to Genroin (the Chamber of Elders) (Japan) by Kenkichi KATAOKA in October 1887.

sen.j: 大同団結運動と並んで自由民権運動の最後を飾る運動として知られている。
sen.e: It is known as the last campaign of the Freedom and People's Rights Movement as well as the campaign to unite for a common purpose.

sen.j: 1886年、第1次伊藤内閣の外務大臣 (日本)井上馨が条約改正のための会議を諸外国の使節団と改正会議を行うが、その提案には関税の引き上げや外国人判事の任用など譲歩を示した。
sen.e: In 1886, Kaoru INOUE, Minister of Foreign Affairs (Japan) in The First Ito Cabinet, held a meeting for revision of a treaty with delegation from foreign countries, and the proposal in the meeting included some compromises such as raising tax and employment of foreign judges.

sen.j: このため、小村寿太郎や鳥尾小弥太、法律顧問ギュスターヴ・エミール・ボアソナードがこれに反対意見を提出し、更に翌1887年には農商務大臣谷干城が辞表を提出する騒ぎとなった。
sen.e: Therefore, Jutaro KOMURA, Koyata TORIO, and Gustave Emile BOISSONADE submitted the adverse opinion, and furthermore, it caused a scene that Minister of Agriculture and Commerce, Tateki TANI turned in his resignation in 1887.

sen.j: これを知った民権派が一斉に政府を非難し、東京では学生や壮士によるデモも起こされた。
sen.e: All of the members of the Civil-Right group who knew it blamed the government, and in Tokyo, students and political activists caused a demonstration.
Members of the Civil-Right group who found out about this unanimously criticized the government, and in Tokyo, students and political activists caused a demonstration.
sen.cmt: おそらく「一斉に」がAll ofとなっているのですが、unanimously criticizedと変更しました。また、who knew it をwho found out about thisと変更しました。
sen.e: Members of the Civil-Right group who found out about this unanimously criticized the government, and in Tokyo, students and political activists caused a demonstration.

sen.j: このような中で片岡健吉を代表とする高知県の民権派が、今回の混乱は国辱的な欧化政策と言論弾圧による世論の抑圧にあると唱えて、①言論の自由の確立②地租軽減による民心の安定③外交の回復（対等な立場による条約改正実現）を柱とした「三大事件建白」と呼ばれる建白書を提出した。
sen.e: Amidst these situations, the Civil-Right group in Kochi Prefecture submitted a petition called "the three biggest petitions" focusing on 1) establishment of free speech, 2) restoring mental balance of civilians by reducing a land tax, and 3) recovery of diplomacy (realization of revision of a treaty on an equal footing), saying these unrests were because of a policy of Europeanization as national disgrace and oppression of public opinions.

sen.j: 折りしも、後藤象二郎による大同団結運動が盛り上がっている最中であり、片岡の他に尾崎行雄や星亨もこれにこうじて民権派の団結と政府批判を呼びかけた。
sen.e: Just then, the campaign to unite for a common purpose by Shojiro GOTO was gathering stream, while Yukio OZAKI and Toru HOSHI other than KATAOKA called for unity of the Civil-Right group and criticize the government in accordance with the campaign.

Just then, the campaign to unite for a common purpose by Shojiro GOTO was gathering stream, while Yukio OZAKI and Toru HOSHI, as well as KATAOKA, called for unity of the Civil-Right group and to criticize the government in accordance with the campaign.
sen.cmt: other than をas well asと変更しました。Calle for がcriticizeにもかかるはずなので、こちらもto criticizeと修正しました。
sen.e: Just then, the campaign to unite for a common purpose by Shojiro GOTO was gathering stream, while Yukio OZAKI and Toru HOSHI, as well as KATAOKA, called for unity of the Civil-Right group and to criticize the government in accordance with the campaign.

sen.j: これに対して政府は同年12月に保安条例を発布して片岡を逮捕したほか多数の運動家を追放・逮捕してこの運動は挫折を余儀なくされた。
sen.e: On the other hand, the government promulgated hoan jorei (regulations for the preservation of law and order) in December of the year before arresting KATAOKA and banishing or arresting many other activists, and then this campaign had no choice but to be collapsed.

Against these activity, the government promulgated hoan jorei (regulations for the preservation of law and order) in December 1887 and arrested Kataoka, as well as exiled and arrested many other activists, and thus this campaign had no choice but to be collapsed.
sen.cmt: 「これに対して」がOn the other hand, となっていますが、Against these activity, と修正しました。「同年12月に」がin December of the year before arresting …となっているところを、in December 1887 and arrested Kataoka, as well as exiled and arrested many…と変更しました。
sen.e: Against these activity, the government promulgated hoan jorei (regulations for the preservation of law and order) in December 1887 and arrested Kataoka, as well as exiled and arrested many other activists, and thus this campaign had no choice but to be collapsed.

sen.j: また、この影響で大同団結運動も分裂を来たし、自由民権運動は大きな曲がり角に差し掛かる事になった。
sen.e: In addition, this movement caused breakup of the campaign to unite for a common purpose and the Freedom and People's Rights Movement reached a tuning point by it.
In addition, this caused breakup of the campaign to unite for a common purpose and the Freedom and People's Rights Movement reached a tuning point.
sen.cmt: this movement が政府の対応なのか三大事件建白運動なのか分かりにくいので、単に前文にかけて、thisとします。Causedと先に出ているので、by itを削除しました。
